Package main.java.Talkbox.configurer

Class Configuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.Talkbox.configurer.Configuration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, main.java.Talkbox.configurer.TalkBoxConfiguration
    public class Configuration
extends java.lang.Object
implements main.java.Talkbox.configurer.TalkBoxConfiguration
    Configuration for the Talkbox interface. Creates a directory to store configurations for each button. Each configuration contains a serialized configuration object, the associated "sound" folder with WAVE files, and optionally an image file in the "image" folder.
    Version:
    Feb 19th 2019
    Author:
    Alberto Mastrofrancesco, Jordan Malek, Rohan Talkad
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • buttonConfigs

        public transient main.java.Talkbox.configurer.ButtonConfiguration[] buttonConfigs

    • Constructor Detail

      • Configuration

        public Configuration​(java.lang.String path)
        This constructor is only used for creating a new configuration Constructor for configuration instance. Creates the directory folder with button configuration folders. The default number of buttons is six.
        Parameters:
        path - the directory in which the talkboxData directory is being made in

    • Method Detail

      • readConfiguration

        public static Configuration readConfiguration​(java.io.File file)
        This method is for fully reading a configuration from a file.
        Parameters:
        file - - the file of the talkboxData directory
        Returns:
        the configuration complete with the button configurations, etc

      • serializeConfig

        public void serializeConfig()
        Serializes the current Configuration instance. File is placed in the default directory in the "serialized_config" folder.

      • createButtonConfigsDirs

        public void createButtonConfigsDirs()
        Creates specified amount of button configuration directories in the default directory.

      • addSetName

        public void addSetName​(int j,
                       java.lang.String newName)
        Add set's name.
        Parameters:
        j - The given set.

      • addButtonConfig

        public void addButtonConfig​(int i)
        Adds the specified button config folder. Each folder contains a button.txt specifying the button's text, audio file, and color.
        Parameters:
        i - The button number.

      • addAudioSet

        public void addAudioSet()
        Add an audio set (6 buttons a set) to the Talkbox. A set can be swapped out for another set at any time.

      • getButtonConfigs

        public main.java.Talkbox.configurer.ButtonConfiguration[] getButtonConfigs()
        Returns the button configuration objects.

      • getConfigDir

        public java.lang.String getConfigDir()
        Returns the path to the current Talkbox configuration directory.
        Returns:
        The string path to the Talkbox configuration directory.

      • getNumberOfAudioButtons

        public int getNumberOfAudioButtons()
        Returns the number of active buttons that when pressed will play an audio file.
        Specified by:
        getNumberOfAudioButtons in interface main.java.Talkbox.configurer.TalkBoxConfiguration
        Returns:
        int The total number of active buttons.

      • getNumberOfAudioSets

        public int getNumberOfAudioSets()
        Returns the number of sets of audio files that this configuration supports for each button.
        Specified by:
        getNumberOfAudioSets in interface main.java.Talkbox.configurer.TalkBoxConfiguration
        Returns:
        int A positive integer

      • getTotalNumberOfButtons

        public int getTotalNumberOfButtons()
        Returns the total number of buttons in this TalkBox.
        Specified by:

      • getRelativePathToAudioFiles

        public java.nio.file.Path getRelativePathToAudioFiles()
        Returns a Path relative to this configuration object. The audio files are contained within the various config folders for each button
        Specified by:
        getRelativePathToAudioFiles in interface main.java.Talkbox.configurer.TalkBoxConfiguration
        Returns:
        Path A Path object that identifies the directory that contains the the config folders for each button.

      • getAudioFileNames

        public java.lang.String[][] getAudioFileNames()
        Returns a 2-dimensional array of Strings that contains the names of all audio files. Each row of the array is an audio set. The dimensions of the array are given by getNumberOfAudioButtons and getNumberOfAudioSets
        Specified by:
        getAudioFileNames in interface main.java.Talkbox.configurer.TalkBoxConfiguration
        Returns:
        A 2-dimensional array of Strings

      • removeAudioSet

        public void removeAudioSet​(int audioSet)
        Removes the i-th (1 .. n) audio set's button_config_ folders. Renames the remaining configuration folders to continue from the previous ones.
        Parameters:
        audioSet - The audioset to remove.
